description.narrative: For GGF funds will be used to fund the first year of a three year project Action for Women and Rural Development (AWARD) is implementing that will focus on sustaining the livelihoods of the communities of Chorge Umbari and Jadhav Umbari. AWARD will address issues related to sustainable agriculture and food provisioning by training local farmers on organic, sustainable agriculture practices; setting up two community seed banks for conservation and promotion of traditional crop varieties; continuing to establish organic kitchen gardens throughout the communities; hosting a biodiversity festival to celebrate traditional agricultural methods. The organization will work with women in the communities to promote sustainable harvesting of medical plants in the nearby forests and developing market access mechanisms for the selling of these. This support will allow AWARD to develop a full proposal for increasing the irrigation system in Chorge Umbari

participating-org.narrative: Action for Women and Rural Development
